products.name: Shopify Payments - D2C Plus, Shopify for ent, CCS (MSERV-FIN-SP-D2C-P)

salesforce.competitor_position: Strong - Shopify holds weight here with Brewdog + recharge
salesforce.compelling_event: New CEO has challenged Leadership team in UK to become customer obsessed - D2C experience outlined as below required level. ATG support EOL. Now is Discovery with Fuse Fabric
salesforce.next_steps: 18/02 BR Discovery with Fuse ending next week. Board / sign off meeting for 24/03. Still awaiting feedback on Plus vs Ent before we can finalise commercials

meddpicc_analysis.summary: Direct Wines Limited is a $4.58M ACV new business opportunity ($13.76M 3-year total revenue) involving a full D2C platform migration plus Shopify Payments across their multi-brand, multi-regional wine subscription and retail business (~$162M D2C GMV, $210.6M Payments GPV). The deal is in Demonstrate stage at 60% probability with a 2026-03-31 close date, but faces active competition from commercetools, unresolved Enterprise vs Plus pricing decisions, significant payments rate gap concerns, and a critical board sign-off meeting on 24/03. The engagement has shifted from an initial US-based champion (Neil Sumner) to a UK leadership team (COO Neil Rhodes, Group CIO Martyn Oakley, MD Matt Knight), introducing new dynamics and requiring re-establishment of champion relationships.

narratives.why_change: Direct Wines is running on an aging Oracle ATG platform approaching end-of-life for support, creating operational risk and dev bottlenecks. Current tech stack (including Contentful) causes pain: slow speed to market, high dev costs (~$8M annual), lack of agility, and difficulty managing 12+ brands across 16+ websites. New CEO has challenged UK leadership to become customer obsessed, explicitly calling out D2C experience as below required level. Business needs to double sales due to supply chain restructuring — potential 50% revenue growth target that current platform cannot support.
narratives.why_shopify: Shopify evaluated for ability to dramatically reduce dev costs (50-90% reduction cited), consolidate fragmented tech stack, and accelerate time-to-market. Key differentiators: Shop Pay conversion advantages, Shopify Audiences, checkout extensibility, integrated Recharge subscription capability (critical for subscription-heavy wine business). Competitive position strong with Brewdog + Recharge references. However, concerns persist about revenue share pricing, payments rate gap (Tim Curtis flagged 'sizeable gap' in UK rates), and 0.35% variable platform fee challenged.
narratives.why_now: Primary drivers: new CEO mandate for digital transformation, ATG support EOL, Fuse Fabric completing discovery week of 2026-02-18, board sign-off meeting scheduled 24/03. Combined with need to double sales capacity and active board decision cycle. Close date of 2026-03-31 is extremely tight given Enterprise vs Plus decision unresolved and payments commercials remain contentious.
narratives.support_needed: 1) Enterprise vs Plus comparison document (blocking commercial finalization, #1 immediate gap). 2) Payments rate competitiveness — Tim Curtis flagged 'sizeable gap' in UK rates + T+3 settlement impact. 3) Token migration clarity including Scheme Reference Data (SRD) for UK subscriptions. 4) Brand definition and multi-region pricing model resolution. 5) Peer references (Brewdog) for 24/03 board meeting. 6) Fuse Fabric alignment to ensure their recommendation supports Shopify. 7) Reframing value narrative for tech team (avoid dev cost displacement messaging that alienates CIO).

questions.question: Business reasons to act identified
questions.notes: Multiple calls confirm: ATG EOL, CEO mandate, need to double sales, high dev costs, poor D2C experience.

questions.notes: Some quantifiable goals: $8M dev spend reduction (50-90%), need to double sales. Specific post-migration KPIs not articulated.

questions.action: Ben Rees to propose metrics framework during Fuse Fabric discovery wrap-up.

questions.question: Pain identified
questions.notes: Extensively documented: ATG EOL, high dev costs ($8M), slow speed to market, poor D2C experience, Contentful pain, multi-brand challenges, subscription complexity.

questions.question: Previous attempts to solve
questions.notes: Historical resistance to platform changes (Call 10), tech team defensiveness (Call 8). Previous attempts faced internal pushback.

questions.notes: Multiple teams: ecommerce (Andy Brooks), tech (Martyn Oakley), finance (Tim Curtis/Octavia), commercial (Neil Rhodes/Matt Knight). Specific extent per team not quantified.

questions.question: Urgency established

questions.question: Alternatives explored
questions.notes: commercetools is active alternative. 'Doing nothing' also an option if neither platform compelling enough.

questions.question: Urgency drivers validated
questions.notes: CEO mandate, ATG EOL, supply chain restructuring, board decision timeline all validated through multiple calls.

questions.question: Shopify uniquely positioned
questions.notes: Well-positioned on many dimensions (subscription, multi-brand, checkout, ecosystem). But commercetools may win on composable flexibility. Payments rates disadvantage.

questions.question: Champion identified
questions.notes: Complex and at risk. Neil Sumner was initial champion but no longer in recent calls. Andy Brooks most active but listed as Launch Contact, not champion. Advocacy level unclear.

questions.question: Champion has political capital
questions.notes: Neil Sumner had VP-level capital. Andy Brooks has domain expertise but unclear board-level influence. Neil Rhodes has credibility but is EB, not champion.

questions.question: Competitors identified

questions.question: Competitor strengths/weaknesses known

questions.question: Win/lose factors identified
questions.notes: Win: subscription ecosystem, speed-to-market, lower TCO, Brewdog reference. Lose: payments rate gap, less flexible composable architecture, platform fee at scale, Ent vs Plus confusion.
questions.solution: Build explicit win/lose analysis and address lose factors.
questions.action: Prepare competitive positioning document.

calls.title: Direct Wines x Shopify - Migration of Tokens
calls.ai_summary: Focused on PCI-compliant credit card tokenization migration and platform pricing. Tim Curtis emphasized SRD migration for UK subscriptions, challenged brand definition and 0.35% variable platform fee.

calls.title: Fusefabric <> Direct Wines - Understanding Your Transformation Capabilities
Direct Wines | Shopify - Shopify Payments
calls.ai_summary: Direct Wines expressed significant concern over 'sizeable gap' between current and proposed UK rates. Impact on working capital from T+3 settlement. Token migration complexity discussed.

calls.title: Direct Wines x Shopify (Platform Fee Sync)
calls.ai_summary: Enterprise vs Plus pricing discussion. Enterprise: $127K/17 brands with dedicated support/SLAs. Plus: $2,300/brand but higher transaction costs, no dedicated TAM. Neil Rhodes needs clear comparison.

calls.title: Fusefabric <> Direct Wines : Understanding Your Business (2 of 3)
Fusefabric <> Direct Wines - Understanding your business (1 of 3): eCommerce
Fusefabric <> Direct Wines Workshop 1, Kick off & Business Overview
Direct Wines | Shopify UK: Introduction Call
Direct Wines x Shopify (Commercials)
calls.ai_summary: Enterprise pricing: $217K/mo USD or £161K GBP including expansion stores. Recharge: £105K + processing fee (40% discount). Neil Sumner highlighted need to justify 'why' of platform change.

calls.title: Direct Wines x Shopify (Demo)
calls.ai_summary: Platform overview: customer journey, admin, themes. Direct Wines interested in Shop App and checkout. Andy Brooks voiced concerns about revenue share model, emphasizing cost reduction goals.

calls.title: Direct Wines x Shopify (Overview)
calls.ai_summary: Reintroduced Shopify highlighting 50-90% reduction in $8M annual dev spend. Shopify Audiences and Shop Pay differentiation discussed. Andy agreed to follow-up demo.

calls.title: Direct Wines x Shopify (Tech Solutioning)
calls.ai_summary: Migration planning: multi-brand management needs, Contentful pain points, need for speed/agility. Want to get Andy (tech team) on board.

calls.title: Direct Wines x Shopify (Finalize Deck)
calls.ai_summary: Neil Sumner concerned about tech team defensiveness. Business needs to double sales due to supply chain restructuring. Potential 50% revenue growth with functional platform. Reframe value as speed-to-market.

calls.title: Direct Wines x Shopify x Recharge (Deck Sync)
calls.ai_summary: Shopify migration plan for Laithwaites first. Tech stack consolidation, dev cost reduction. Neil cautioned against exaggerating data. Aims to present Shopify checkout to global CEO.

calls.title: Direct Wines x Shopify (Sync)
calls.ai_summary: Explored Commerce Components for quicker integration plus full migration. Lauren shared ATG checkout challenges and team's historical resistance. Interested in phased approach.
